content:
DSB accumulation triggers senescence-associated secretory phenotype (SASP), which creates a pro-tumorigenic microenvironment, and senolytic therapies targeting SASP-secreting cells can reduce tumor promotion.  
*Supporting evidence:* SASP factors promote tumor growth and are induced by persistent DNA damage [Coppe 2010]. Senolytics can limit tumorigenic effects of SASP [Kirkland 2017, J Am Geriatr Soc].

---
